channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Donald Trump says he has ‘obligation’ to sue BBC over speech edit – latest updates
item.description: US president claims broadcaster has ‘defrauded the public’ and reiterates his threat of launching a $1bn legal action Responding to UK culture secreta...

item.title: Venezuelans sent by Trump to El Salvador endured systematic torture, report finds
item.description: Human rights groups accuse Trump officials of complicity and draw comparison with scandal at Abu Ghraib prison More than 252 Venezuelans expelled to E...

item.title: Actor Allison Mack reveals role in Nxivm sex cult in new podcast: ‘I was abusive’
item.description: Smallville actor, released from prison two years ago, tells how she helped coerce women for cult leader Keith Raniere The Smallville actor Allison Mac...

item.title: Ukraine suspends justice minister amid energy corruption scandal – Europe live
item.description: Prime minister Yulia Svyrydenko said that the decision to suspend German Galushchenko had been taken at an emergency government session Meanwhile, the...

item.title: Streeting says Starmer should sack aides responsible for hostile briefings against him – UK politics live
item.description: The health secretary said he ‘cannot see circumstances’ in which he would challenge Starmer for leadership The No 10 briefing row is not the only stor...

item.title: Streeting denies plotting against PM after leadership claims
item.description: Wes Streeting has urged Sir Keir Starmer to sack whoever is briefing the media about challenges to the PM's leadership.

item.title: Henry Zeffman: Efforts to shore up Starmer's leadership may have backfired
item.description: Briefings aimed at seeing off leadership plots may have left the PM more vulnerable, some in Labour fear.

item.title: Government to rethink rejection of Waspi compensation
item.description: Pensions Secretary Pat McFadden says that the rethink does not mean that payouts will necessarily follow.

item.title: Seven men charged in child sexual exploitation probe
item.description: The men have been charged with more than 40 child exploitation offences against 11 victims.

item.title: New consoles used to come out every five years – so where's the PlayStation 6?
item.description: On the fifth anniversary of the PlayStation 5, the firm says its focus remains on its current console.
